meanings.definition: Subjected to too much stress or pressure.
meanings.sent1: She looked tired and overworked, clearly overstressed.
meanings.sent2: The students were visibly overstressed during exam week.
meanings.sent3: The poor computer seemed to be overstressed with all the programs running at once.
meanings.sent4: Her mind felt like an overstressed rubber band, ready to snap at any moment.
meanings.sent5: The bridge, overstressed by the weight of the trucks, finally collapsed.

meanings.definition: To place too much stress or pressure on someone or something.
meanings.sent1: Try not to overstress yourself with too many tasks at once.
meanings.sent2: The coach didn't want to overstress the players before the big game.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally overstressed the fragile vase by placing heavy books on top of it.
meanings.sent4: The tree branches were overstressed by the weight of the snow, causing them to break.
meanings.sent5: The teacher didn't want to overstress the students with too much homework over the weekend.
